structure.unit: Executive And Administrative Officers Of The Commonwealth
State Superintendent Of Buildings, And State House

law.text: [ Text of section effective until July 1, 2012. For text effective July 1, 2012, see below.] The superintendent may expend not more than fifteen hundred dollars annually for the maintenance of the museum established in the state house for the preservation and exhibition of the regimental flags and other military relics in the possession of the commonwealth and of other objects connected with the military history of the United States and especially of the New England states. Chapter 8: Military history museum [ Text of section as amended by 2012, 139, Sec. 17 effective July 1, 2012. See 2012, 139, Sec. 229. For text effective until July 1, 2012, see above.] The superintendent may expend not more than $10,000 from the State House Special Event Fund established in section 35P of chapter 10 annually for the maintenance of the museum established in the state house for the preservation and exhibition of the regimental flags and other military relics in the possession of the commonwealth and of other objects connected with the military history of the United States and especially of the New England states.
